items.todoItem: Know that Paul’s mission for God was to the Gentiles.
Take note that Paul’s imprisonment because of Jesus did not prevent his ministry to the Gentiles.
Know that God often chooses to use people to achieve His purpose.
Know that Paul was given the provision of God’s grace for the stewardship and benefit of the Gentiles.
Know that God gives knowledge of His plans by revelation.
Know that God made His plans known to Paul by revelation.
Know that Paul’s knowledge of Jesus came by revelation.
Know that God decides at what moment in history and to whom revelation is given.
Know that the Holy Spirit gives revelation to the sons of men.
Know that Gentiles are fellow heirs and partakers of God’s promise in the body of Christ by the gospel.
Know that it was God’s continual gift of grace that Paul said enabled him to minister the gospel with miraculous power to the Gentiles.
Know that Paul was made a minister by God and did not choose this honour for himself.
Know that God supplied and furnished Paul for the work to the Gentiles.
Know that Paul considered himself less than the least of all the saints.
Know that each and every saint has an equally important part to play in God’s plan and purpose.
Know that it is the grace of God that Paul said gave him his ability to preach Christ to the Gentiles.
Know that Paul was sent as a minister to preach the immense riches of Christ to the Gentiles.
Know that there are incomprehensible and abundant riches to be found in Christ.
Know that it was God’s plan from the beginning to unite Jews and Gentiles in the body of Christ.
Know that God chooses to reveal His plans to whom He will and only when He is ready to do so.
Know that God created all things by Jesus Christ.
Know that it was always God’s plan to make His manifold wisdom known to those in heavenly places through the revelation given to His church.
Know that God’s eternal plan involved Jesus Christ our Lord from the very beginning.
Know that God has positioned His Son Jesus Christ at the centre of His plans for all eternity.
Know that faith in Christ gives boldness and direct access to the Father who we may approach with confidence.
Don’t be exhausted by the tribulation of others for your benefit but rather glory in it.
Know that Paul endured tribulation for his ministry to the Gentiles.
Follow Paul’s example of how he honours and reverences God by kneeling to pray.
Bend your knees and pray to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Know that the whole family in heaven and earth is named after Jesus Christ.
Pray in accordance with the abundant riches of His glory that God would strengthen you with miraculous power by His Spirit which dwells within you.
Pray that Christ may dwell at the centre of your life by faith.
Pray that you may be firmly rooted and grounded in God’s unconditional love.
Pray that you and your Christian brethren may comprehend  to take full possession of and be possessed by the love of Christ.
Know that the unconditional love of Christ surpasses knowledge.
Pray to know the love of Christ and be filled with all the abundance of God.
Know that God is able to do abundantly more than we ask or think through His miraculous power that works in us.
Know that God’s Holy Spirit is at work within us.
Let every generation give glory to God in the church by Christ Jesus forever.
Take note that Paul prays for those to whom he is ministering.
